fine_dining.name: Restaurant Vue (at Hotel Bellevue Palace)
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus highlighting Swiss ingredients with French techniques, offering exceptional views of the Alps and Aare river.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, refined dining room in one of Bern's most prestigious hotels with stunning terrace views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve well in advance; request window or terrace seating; formal attire recommended
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Bern's most prestigious dining experiences. The view alone is worth the visit, but the sophisticated cuisine and impeccable service complete the experience.

fine_dining.name: Meridiano (at Kursaal Bern)
signature_dishes: Creative seasonal tasting menus by chef Fabian Raffeiner, featuring modern interpretations of classic dishes with Mediterranean influences.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary, elegant setting with panoramic views of the Old Town and Alps
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specify any dietary requirements; request a window table for the view
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its beautiful presentation and panoramic views. The tasting menu with wine pairing offers an exceptional dining experience.

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Schöngrün
signature_dishes: Refined seasonal tasting menus featuring locally-sourced ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, intimate dining room in a historical villa set in the Paul Klee Center gardens
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 2-3 weeks in advance; combine with a visit to the Paul Klee Center
fine_dining.location: Near Paul Klee Center (slightly outside city center)
fine_dining.local_tips: Exceptional dining in a tranquil setting. The relationship with the Paul Klee Center gives the restaurant a unique artistic connection.

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Kornhauskeller
signature_dishes: Classic Swiss and French dishes with modern touches
Specialties include beef tartare, Bernese platter, and seasonal game dishes
fine_dining.atmosphere: Spectacular vaulted baroque cellar from 1718, ornate paintings, imposing pillars, romantic lighting
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve in advance; request seating in the main vaulted area for the full experience
fine_dining.local_tips: While not Michelin-starred, this is one of Bern's most impressive dining spaces. The historic baroque cellar setting is truly unique and worth experiencing.

casual_dining.name: Lötschberg
signature_dishes: Cheese fondue (various types including truffle, champagne)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, rustic-modern Swiss chalet style, popular and lively
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead, especially for dinner; specify fondue or raclette preference; outdoor seating available in warmer months.
casual_dining.local_tips: One of the best places in Bern for authentic Swiss cheese specialties. Known for both traditional recipes and creative variations using high-quality regional cheeses.

casual_dining.name: Restaurant Harmonie
signature_dishes: Berner Platte (traditional assortment of meats and sauerkraut)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional Swiss restaurant, wooden interiors, cozy and authentic
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular with locals for traditional dishes; hearty portions.
casual_dining.local_tips: A genuine local favorite for authentic Bernese cuisine. The Berner Platte is enormous and ideal for sharing or very hearty appetites.

casual_dining.name: Altes Tramdepot
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively brewpub with terrace offering stunning views of the Old Town and Aare river
casual_dining.booking_tips: Request terrace seating in good weather for the views; brewery tours sometimes available.
casual_dining.location: Next to Bear Park (east end of Old Town)
casual_dining.local_tips: Popular for its house-brewed beers and spectacular views. Try the beer sampler to taste their different brews.

casual_dining.name: Tibits
signature_dishes: Self-service buffet with over 40 vegetarian and vegan dishes
Seasonal specialties and daily changing menu
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, bright, casual self-service restaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations needed; can be busy at peak lunch hours; food paid by weight.
casual_dining.local_tips: Excellent option for vegetarians and vegans. Quality is consistently high and the selection varied. Good for a quick, healthy meal.

casual_dining.name: Pizzeria Da Bucolo
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, authentic Italian trattoria, often bustling and lively
casual_dining.booking_tips: Small restaurant that fills quickly; known for authentic Italian cuisine at reasonable prices.
casual_dining.local_tips: Hidden gem serving some of Bern's best authentic Italian food. Family-run with recipes from Sicily. The seafood pasta is excellent when available.

street_food.name: Bern Wochenmarkt (Tuesday & Saturday mornings)
street_food.local_tips: Bern's main market and a wonderful place to experience local food culture. Tuesday markets are smaller; Saturday markets are larger and livelier.

street_food.name: Streat Food Market (Warmbächli)
specialties: International street food from various vendors and food trucks
Changing selection of cuisines (Asian, Middle Eastern, American, etc.)
street_food.hours: Typically Friday evenings, check schedule for exact dates
street_food.local_tips: Popular monthly food market with a hipster vibe. Check their social media for dates and participating vendors.

street_food.name: Food Stands at Bundesplatz
specialties: Seasonal specialties (e.g., chestnuts in winter, ice cream in summer)
street_food.local_tips: The selection varies by season and during special events. During Christmas markets, the options expand significantly.

street_food.name: Gelateria di Berna
street_food.hours: Typically 12 PM - 10 PM (seasonal, longer hours in summer)
street_food.location: Multiple locations including Marzili and Breitenrain
street_food.local_tips: Extremely popular local gelato chain with unique, high-quality flavors. Expect queues in summer months, but worth the wait.

coffee_shops.name: Einstein Kaffee & Raritäten
coffee_shops.specialty: Historic Coffee House with Famous Einstein Connection
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic, traditional café in the building where Einstein lived when developing his Theory of Relativity
coffee_shops.food_options: Full breakfast and lunch menu, pastries, cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Historic café on the first floor of the Einstein Museum. Great spot to soak in the atmosphere where Einstein once lived and worked.

coffee_shops.name: Adrianos Bar & Café
must_try: House-roasted coffee beans (also available to purchase)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, stylish café with knowledgeable baristas and coffee focus
coffee_shops.local_tips: Bern's premier specialty coffee destination. Own roastery and highly skilled baristas make this a must-visit for coffee enthusiasts.

coffee_shops.name: Café Fédéral
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional café with political significance due to its location opposite the Federal Palace, often frequented by politicians and journalists
coffee_shops.food_options: Full breakfast and lunch menu, traditional Swiss pastries
coffee_shops.local_tips: The place to spot Swiss politicians and journalists. During parliament sessions, you might overhear interesting political discussions.

coffee_shops.name: Café Montag
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, minimalist, modern café popular with younger crowd and remote workers
coffee_shops.food_options: Light breakfast, sandwiches, cakes, weekend brunch
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with digital nomads and the creative crowd. Good workspace during weekdays and excellent weekend brunch.

coffee_shops.name: Lehrerzimmer
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Quirky, homey café with mismatched furniture and a living-room feel
coffee_shops.food_options: Light meals, soups, sandwiches, excellent cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Charming café outside the main tourist area. The name means 'Teacher's Room' and it has a casual, community feel with excellent homemade cakes.

bars.name: Sky Terrace (at Hotel Schweizerhof)
bars.atmosphere: Elegant rooftop terrace with stunning views of Bern's Old Town and the Alps
bars.local_tips: One of the best views in Bern. Open seasonally (summer months). Weather dependent.

bars.name: Abflugbar
signature_drinks: Extensive cocktail menu with creative house specialties
bars.atmosphere: Stylish, intimate cocktail bar with aviation theme, knowledgeable bartenders
bars.local_tips: One of Bern's best cocktail bars with a flight/travel theme ('Abflug' means 'departure'). Known for quality and creativity.

bars.name: Kornhauskeller Bar
signature_drinks: Extensive wine list featuring Swiss and international selections
bars.atmosphere: Spectacular baroque vaulted cellar with ornate paintings and impressive architecture
bars.food_options: Bar menu available, full restaurant adjacent
bars.reservation_needed: Not essential for bar seating but recommended
bars.local_tips: Even if you don't dine at the restaurant, the bar area is worth visiting for the stunning historical architecture and ambiance.

bars.name: Turnhalle
bars.atmosphere: Former gymnasium converted into a cultural space and bar, casual, alternative vibe
bars.local_tips: Multi-purpose space hosting concerts, exhibitions, and events. Check their program online. Popular with Bern's creative community.

bars.name: Marzilibrücke Bar (Summer only)
bars.specialty: Summer Drinks by the Aare River
bars.atmosphere: Relaxed, outdoor summer bar with views of swimmers in the Aare river
bars.local_tips: Seasonal bar that captures Bern's summer riverside culture. Perfect after a swim in the Aare or for watching the sunset.

food_tours.name: Bern Food Discovery Tour
highlights: Learning about Bernese food traditions and culture
Visiting the local market and specialty stores
food_tours.booking_tips: Book through Bern Tourism or specialized food tour companies. Wear comfortable shoes and come hungry.

food_tours.name: Aare River & Old Town Culinary Walk
highlights: Sampling local specialties at various stops
Learning about Bern's history and food culture
Walking along the scenic Aare river and through the UNESCO-listed Old Town
food_tours.booking_tips: Tours run primarily in warmer months. Combines historical information with culinary stops.

cooking_classes.name: Swiss Fondue & Raclette Workshop
what_you_learn: Selecting the right cheese combinations for fondue
Proper preparation techniques and ideal consistency
includes: Hands-on cooking, ingredients, recipes, enjoying the prepared meal together
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Ideal winter activity. Check with cooking schools and culinary event providers in Bern for current offerings.

cooking_classes.name: Bernese Pastry & Cookie Making
what_you_learn: Traditional recipes for Swiss cookies like Brunsli, Mailänderli, Spitzbuebe
Techniques for working with Swiss pastry
Cultural significance of Swiss baking traditions
includes: Ingredients, recipes, baked goods to take home
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Especially popular during holiday seasons. Book well in advance for Christmas cookie workshops.

markets.name: Bern Wochenmarkt (Weekly Market)
highlights: Regional cheeses, meats, and dairy products
markets.best_time: Saturday morning for full market experience
markets.local_tips: Bern's main market has been operating for centuries. Saturday markets are larger and more diverse than Tuesday markets.

markets.name: Alpines Museum Market
highlights: Mountain cheese varieties from different Alpine regions
Dried meats and sausages from mountain areas
Alpine herbs, teas, and specialty foods
markets.local_tips: Specialized market focusing on authentic Alpine products. Great for cheese lovers. Only happens a few times a year.

markets.name: Onion Market (Zibelemärit)
markets.hours: Fourth Monday in November, 5 AM - 6 PM
markets.best_time: Early morning for traditional experience, daytime for general atmosphere
markets.local_tips: One of Bern's most famous traditional events. Locals start at 5 AM with confetti battles and mulled wine. Over 50 tons of onions are sold in decorative braids.

spring: Bärlauch (Wild Garlic) - In soups, pesto, butter
White Asparagus (Spargel) - Served with ham, potatoes, hollandaise
summer: Fresh berries (particularly raspberries and strawberries from the Emmental region)
Outdoor dining along the Aare river
Marzili district outdoor grilling and picnics
autumn: Wild Game (Hirsch - venison, Reh - roe deer)
Berner Platte (hearty mixed meat platter, traditional autumn dish)
Zibelechueche (Onion tart during the Onion Market festival)
winter: Cheese Fondue (especially moitié-moitié with Gruyère and Vacherin)
Raclette (melted cheese with potatoes and pickles)
Berner Rösti (crispy grated potatoes, Bernese style)
Grittibänz (bread figure for St. Nicholas Day)
